{{infobox character | people=[[Dwarves|Dwarf]] | name=Dís | image=Gregor Roffalski - Dís.jpg | caption="Dís" by [[:Category:Images by Gregor Roffalski|Gregor Roffalski]] | pronun= | othernames= | titles=Lady of Erebor | position= | location=[[Lonely Mountain]] | affiliation= | language=[[Khuzdul]] | birth={{TA|2760}} | birthlocation=[[Erebor]] | rule= | death=unknown (aged 104+) | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house=[[House of Durin]] | parentage=[[Thráin]] | siblings=[[Thorin]], [[Frerin]] | spouse=Unnamed husband | children=[[Fíli]], [[Kíli]] | gender=Female | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Dís''' (born [[Third Age]] {{TA|2760|n}}) was a [[Dwarf-women|female]] [[Dwarves|Dwarf]] of the royal line of [[Durin's folk]]. ==History== Dís was the daughter of King [[Thráin|Thráin II]] and younger sister of [[Thorin]] and [[Frerin]]. Like her brothers, she was born in [[Lonely Mountain]] and was driven into exile in {{TA|2770}} when the [[Dragons|dragon]] [[Smaug]] sacked the kingdom. She was the mother of [[Fíli]] and [[Kíli]]. Although female Dwarves were rarely seen by outsiders, or mentioned in Dwarven records, Dís was an exceptional case: her sons were killed heroically defending their mortally wounded uncle Thorin in the [[Battle of Five Armies]].{{App|Durin}} ==Etymology== [[Jim Allan]] has suggested that ''Dís'' is derived from [[Old Norse]] ''-dís'' ("sister") found in many Nordic names (such as ''Herdís'', ''Hjördís'', etc).[[Jim Allan]], "Giving of Names", in ''[[An Introduction to Elvish]]'', p. 225 ==Genealogy== {{familytree/start}} {{familytree| | | | | THR | | | | | | |THR=[[Thrór]]

''{{TA|2864|n}} - {{TA|2941|n}}''†}} {{familytree/end}} ==Portrayal in adaptations== [[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Dís.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Dís in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']] '''2018: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':''' :Although very old, Dís is still alive during the [[War of the Ring]]. She holds the honorary position of the Keeper of [[Ravenhill]], where she tends to ravens now led by Arcah, Daughter of Croär. After the [[Battle of Dale]] she and the surviving companions of [[Thorin Oakenshield]] pay respect to tombs of her brother and sons, which are now next to that of King [[Dain Ironfoot]]. '''2022: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power]]'':''' :A female dwarf named "[[Disa|Princess Disa]]", who has a similar name Dis, appears in the [[Amazon Studios]] television series, but she was created for the show and is not based on the character found in the [[legendarium]]. {{references}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dis}} [[Category:Dwarves]] [[Category:Longbeards]] [[Category:Norse names]] [[Category:Third Age characters]] [[de:Dís]] [[fi:Dís]] [[fr:encyclo:personnages:nains:3a:dis]]
